result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justis Jonathan Dehne

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm. UPDATED OFP with final atty bill. $50/mo, due by the 1st of each month. sf

Clerk called Def to advise that the final attorney bill is filed and September payment has not been received. Def to make payment by Monday, September 19th. Clerk to mail out updated OFP with final atty bill. sf
for Atty fees $717.40. Signed by EFV on 09/02/22. arc   c: CoC and Payment Clerk.
Order for Payment of Attorney Fees in the amount of $717.40. Filed by Atty Dobbe.  gll
Invoice for Attorney Fees. Filed by Atty Dobbe.  gll

- No use or possession of dangerous weapons.

- Comply with terms and conditions of DJOC.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.N.D and A.J.D or residence (DE maybe at residence only if victims are not present and arranged with mother).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S.A.D not at residence .  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

9:50 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Justis Jonathan Dehne. Defendant Justis Jonathan Dehne in court. Court reviews case. Atty Dobbe recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to AMENDED Count 1: Battery- Misd -940.19(1). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty and withholds conviction and enters DJOC. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 2.  Court amends bond. Adjourned at 10:04 AM
